title: State goes active on delete

comments.content:
The state does not change from active on a delete.  It should change to a deleting state.  I've also noticed it will flip to ACTIVE when in a BUILD or ERROR state after deleting the instance.

Occurs in trunk rev 1532
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~antonym

comments.content:
>> The state does not change from active on a delete. It should change to a deleting state.

http://docs.openstack.org/cactus/openstack-compute/developer/openstack-compute-api-1.1/content/Delete_Server-d1e2883.html

According to the specification, there is no "deleting" state. What is happening right now when you delete an active VM is this:

vm_state: ACTIVE
task_state: None

DELETE /v1.1/my_project/servers/1

vm_state: ACTIVE
task_state: DELETING

The OpenStack API doesn't know to display this any differently than ACTIVE, so ACTIVE is displayed. 

I would be 100% for updating the spec to display DELETING, but I feel like that's a 'big' discussion.



>> I've also noticed it will flip to ACTIVE when in a BUILD or ERROR state after deleting the instance.

Hmm, this certainly shouldn't happen. I'll look into reproducing this now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~blamar

comments.content:
Using latest trunk:

vm_state: ERROR
task_state: prep_migration

I'm unable to delete this instance because of it being in ERROR state. This log message says it all:
2011-09-09 15:24:26,213 WARNING nova.compute.api [-] Instance 1 is not in an 'active' state. It is currently error. Shutdown aborted.


Also I tried this:

nova boot --image 3 --flavor 1 test2 && sleep 5 && nova delete test2 && watch -n .5 "nova list"

Which shows the instance in a BUILD state and then it's gone. I can't get it to show ACTIVE when deleting. Can you give steps to reproduce?
